title: ASTRAL Score for Ischemic Stroke
description: Predicts 90-day poor outcome (mRS >2) in patients with acute ischemic stroke. The score combines age, NIHSS, timing, visual defects, glucose levels, and consciousness to stratify prognosis.

parameters.name: nihss_score
parameters.description: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score

parameters.name: onset_to_admission_over_3h
parameters.description: More than 3 hours from symptom onset (or last time seen without stroke symptoms) to admission

parameters.name: visual_field_defect
parameters.description: Presence of any new visual field defect

parameters.name: abnormal_glucose
parameters.description: Admission glucose >131 mg/dL (7.3 mmol/L) or <66 mg/dL (3.7 mmol/L)

result.name: astral_score
result.description: ASTRAL score for predicting 90-day poor outcome

ranges.interpretation: Scores 0-15 points indicate lower probability of poor outcome (mRS >2) at 90 days. Patients in this range have better prognosis for functional independence.
Scores 16-25 points indicate moderate probability of poor outcome (mRS >2) at 90 days. These patients require careful monitoring and intensive rehabilitation planning.

Scores â‰¥26 points indicate high probability of poor outcome (mRS >2) at 90 days. These patients are at high risk for significant disability or death and may benefit from palliative care discussions.

references: Ntaios G, Faouzi M, Ferrari J, Lang W, Vemmos K, Michel P. An integer-based score to predict functional outcome in acute ischemic stroke: the ASTRAL score. Neurology. 2012;78(24):1916-22. doi: 10.1212/WNL.0b013e318259e221.

Ntaios G, Gioulekas F, Papavasileiou V, Strbian D, Michel P. ASTRAL, DRAGON and SEDAN scores predict stroke outcome more accurately than physicians. Eur J Neurol. 2016;23(11):1651-1657. doi: 10.1111/ene.13100.

Liu G, Ntaios G, Zheng H, Wang Y, Michel P, Wang Y. External validation of the ASTRAL score to predict 3- and 12-month functional outcome in the China National Stroke Registry. Stroke. 2013;44(6):1443-50. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.113.001047.
formula: ASTRAL Score = Age + NIHSS + (2 if onset >3h) + (2 if visual field defect) + (1 if abnormal glucose) + (3 if impaired consciousness)
notes: Use only in patients admitted within 24 hours of stroke onset
Score should only be used for patients with pre-stroke independence (mRS 0-2)
Poor outcome defined as modified Rankin Scale (mRS) >2 at 90 days
The score has been externally validated with AUC of approximately 0.82
Use in conjunction with clinical judgment, not as sole decision-making tool
